ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: I like the reading (and the response homework) assigned every week. It is a very organized system and keep each week's discussion fresh.
4 in usual week; 6 hours/wk before the group presentation; 16 hours/qk the two weeks before the individual presentation and final paper.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Jody has a lot to teach! Only thing is she don't have time to teach everything. But she pointed out interesting perspectives and many of which you usually cannot get from reading papers and journals. People have interesting ideas and are inspiring. The TA is great as well.

The course was very interesting. The topics are really interesting and relevant. However, the discussions in class were disorganized and rambling. Though there seemed to be specific concepts that the intructor wanted us to learn, she did not do a good job of clearly explaining them in class. The "lectures" were disorganized. Although the class was supposed to be an economics course, there was very little clear explanation and examination of the economic concepts underlying what were were discussion. The discussions also pretty quicky degenerated into students talking about what they have heard or feel about issues, rather than staying with evidence-based findings.

class is more seminar style. the professor is extremely nice and knowledgeable in her field. however, the dynamic of the course (for some reason or another) fell short of expectationas last years reviews say, discussion could have been facilitated to talk beyond readings but instead were very limited (part of that is due to the mixture of undergraduates and graduates) - it is not the intelligence level but maybe the experience difference that may have made it harder to make the discussion more engaging

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Jody Sindelar  Jody has knows so many things about substance abuse and sad that she cannot teach them all. Wish the materials discussed in class will have more focus

Instructor: Jody Sindelar  The instructor is very knowledgeable in this area. She is also interesting, very nice, and very accessible. However, she very often appeared quite disorganized. Her lectures were fairly disorganized and she didn't do agood job of clearly explaining the main concepts she wanted us to understand. She also put up too often with the class asking very tangential questions and continuing to make comments that were about how they felt or what they heard about topics, which really took the discussion away from evidence-based information.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Kiersten Laurel Strombotne  I can see that Kiersten is going to be a good professor because she is good at teaching! In the Obesity class she had everything in control.
Instructor: Kiersten Laurel Strombotne  The TA is knowledgeable, very nice, and very accessible. The one lecture she gave was organized and intersting. She did a good job as a TA.
Instructor: Kiersten Laurel Strombotne  kiersten is great! she was an essential component to this course, in my opinion. at times, she was able to give the class more structure than it needed

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course was very interesting. The topics are really interesting and relevant. However, the discussions in class were disorganized and rambling. Though there seemed to be specific concepts that the intructor wanted us to learn, she did not do a good job of clearly explaining them in class. The "lectures" were disorganized. Although the class was supposed to be an economics course, there was very little clear explanation and examination of the economic concepts underlying what were were discussion. The discussions also pretty quicky degenerated into students talking about what they have heard or feel about issues, rather than staying with evidence-based findings.
